divs: Sighting DetailsDriving home from celebrating a late family Xmas, I was Southbound on IH-35 justbetween Georgetown and Round Rock, TX. Within an hour of sunset, a largethunderhead was forming West of town that stretched high into the sky, blockingthe sun. There was what seemed like a very unnatural light everywhere from theclouds blocking the sun, but the light refracted around the cloud creating thiseffect. Suddenly I saw what appeared to be a cylindrical object, opaque incolor floating a mile or so away. It was very large and tilted at an angle ofapproximately 60 degrees. The object traveled NxNE very slowly and at the exactelevation the entire time. I could see definition of shape, but could seethrough the object barely, almost like tinted glass. The sun dipped furtherbehind the clouds, the light changed and the object disappeared. I tracked theobject from directly in front of my car to almost perpendicular to the vehiclespassenger window. I tried to wake my son to show him but he did not awaken intime.
trends: There have been 6 other sightings in Georgetown
There were no other sightings in Georgetown on or around December 27th 1998
Summary: flying object, opaque coloration, large size, unk
